reviews.text: I have camped at this campground with my family and friends as seasonal At the end of the year last year we were told that the campground was going to upgrade the grove where I camp. major changes, no trailers older that ten years. Being open to change I decided the wait and see approach...I would wait for one of the owners to approach me. In the mean time my family were making arrangements to have their trailers removed. With a tear in my eye I knew what I must do I must leave...with my sister and nana leaving nothing here would ever be the same. I was done.
reviews.title: Good Bye Old friend

reviews.text: Now my review....I will start with I was never approached or talked to about my options. I started camping here when my middle daughter was 6 months old, There were never any activities in this park. I worked their water slide until it collapsed and they weren't allowed to put it back up. This park needs a serious face lift which I think they are starting. If it is like anything else they do it will take a few years to get it done. This will or should not be listed as a family campground, if you are seasonal you will not be allowed to leave toys on your site. Not family in my eyes.
reviews.title: Family Camping (I don't think so)

reviews.text: There are no activities, the only amenities are a swimming pool and a playground. But remember you make your on time, your own fun. These things were never an issue to me, my family made it's own fun..
reviews.title: Best camping ever seen
Not seasonally friendly review ditto from us!
reviews.text: There is not a lot to say about this campground because they don't have anything. But I will say if you are seasonal there and were allowed to keep your trailer there, what ever your method was to convince them.....hang in there if they make the upgrades they have talked about this park will be sold within the next five years. As I was told everything is for sale for the right price. But they will have to get a lot of money because John and Mike will be out of a job and have never done anything else. It was great working for the family business...but

I will start by saying, the campground was clean, we went mid week so it was quiet and the Black Forest area was newer with nice full hook ups. That said, I was not happy with certain things (buyer beware). We made reservations 6 months in advance for a "good" site. I confirmed a month prior. I pull in at 8:00 pm and they had NO reservation! They had this huge board with labeled sites, our reservation was nowhere to be found. We had to go in one site and move to another the next day. Not happy. They don't have or use a computer. If you even want a confirmation you need to send them a self addressed stamped envelope????? You're kidding right? With that I proceeded to pay. They list this as a family campground right, but rates are based on only two people???? Who are you kidding. The 58.00 rate went up to 70.00 plus tax! That's right, they charged me 4.00 per day per night for all 3 of my kids! If you need to do any business using wi fi, they advertise wifi but it won't reach your campsite. You need to sit within 500 feet of the office. They have no other hotspots. Even with losing our reservation, there was no "comp" for anything. Two days into our stay, I had a gentleman approach me telling me I was in his spot. They seemed to again mess up a reservation. Unfortately he did not get the site he reserved either (as I was now in I). The pool was nice but unseasonably cold for August and too lose to the highway for me. The trolley to the ocean was nice for those who don't tow a car. All in all, it's a place to stay that's two miles from the beach.
reviews.title: Nice but few FYI's
